clustering.sfcm
Class SFCMPlugin

java.lang.Object
  clustering.sfcm.SFCMPlugin
All Implemented Interfaces:
ij.plugin.PlugIn
public class SFCMPlugin
extends java.lang.Object
implements ij.plugin.PlugIn

This class communicates with the user by implementing the ImageJ PlugIn interface It provides an graphical user interface to let the user configure the parameters of the @link{SFCM} algorithm. Then, it configure the @{SFCMManager} instance that will run the algorithm and in the end will display the resulted images encoded by the manager instance.

See Also:
SFCM, SFCMManager, run(java.lang.String)

Method Detail

run

public void run(java.lang.String arg)
Overridden method of the one provided by the @link{PlugIn} interface in ImageJ It takes the currently selected image, validates the image, validates the user inputs and instantiates the @link{SFCMManager} class which manages to run the @link{SFCM} algorithm, in the end it presents the clustered images to the user according to the selected visualization method.

Specified by:
run in interface ij.plugin.PlugIn
Parameters:
arg - an optional string used to determine if the plugin is run for the about help
See Also:
validateColorSpace(ij.ImagePlus, java.lang.String), validateImage(ij.ImagePlus), validateInputParameters(clustering.sfcm.SFCMManager), configureDialog(clustering.sfcm.SFCMManager, ij.gui.GenericDialog)

validateImage

private boolean validateImage(ij.ImagePlus img)
Validates the image type and in case of an invalid image it returns false. Invalid image types are ImagePlus.COLOR_256 as we can't work with those.

Parameters:
img - the @link{ImagePlus}, input of the plugin
Returns:
true if the image is valid , false otherwise

validateColorSpace

private boolean validateColorSpace(ij.ImagePlus img,
                                   java.lang.String colorSpace)
Validates the color space conversion chosen in input. If the user chose to convert a single sliced, non @link{ImagePlus.COLOR_RGB} the input is invalid, if the chosen image is a multi slice image and the user wants to convert it, the input is invalid, otherwise it is valid in all the other case we will have a good input parameter

Parameters:
img - the @link{ImagePlus}, input of the plugin
colorSpace - the color space chosen for conversion allowed values are: "None", "XYZ", "L*a*b*", "HSB"
Returns:
true if parameters are valid otherwise false.

validateInputParameters

private java.lang.String validateInputParameters(SFCMManager sFCMM)
Validates the user input parameters following the following constraints and buils an error message. Calls @link{SFCMManager} to validate each value 1 The fuzzyness value should be positive real number and strictly greater than 1 2 The number of cluster should be greater than 1, it is a integer 3 The tolerance should be greater than 0 , it can be a real number 4 The membership weight should be a positive real number greater than 0 5 The spatial function weight should be a positive real number greater than 0 6 The radius of the window should be and integer and should be strictly greater then 0

Parameters:
sFCMM - the @link{SFCMManager} instace that runs the algorithm
Returns:
An error message telling the user which parameter has been wrongly entered.
See Also:
SFCMManager

configureDialog

private ij.gui.GenericDialog configureDialog(SFCMManager sFCMM,
                                             ij.gui.GenericDialog dialog)
Configures an instance of @link{GenericDialog} adding the gui components to let the user configure the algorithm parameters. To see a complete list of parameters and their explanation , see @link{SFCMManager}

Parameters:
sFCMM - the @link{SFCMManager} instace that runs the algorithm
the - @link{GenericDialog} instance used to show the parameters
Returns:
a configured dialog

getConfigurationFromDialog

private void getConfigurationFromDialog(ij.gui.GenericDialog dialog,
                                        SFCMManager sFCMM)
This method takes all the input parameters from the interface dialog and sest the proper variables in the @link{SFCMManager} instance which will run the algorithm.

Parameters:
dialog - the @link{GenericDialog} instance used to show the parameters
sFCMM - the @link{SFCMManager} instace that runs the algorithm

adjustBrightness

private void adjustBrightness(ij.process.ImageProcessor IP,
                              int nClusters)
Adjusts the brightness of the pixels of a gray scaled image representing a clustered image in order to make the cluster colors more distinctive.

Parameters:
IP - the @link{ImageProcessor} representing the gray scale image
nClusters - the number of clusters
See Also:
run(java.lang.String)

encodeRGBImageFromStack

private ij.ImagePlus encodeRGBImageFromStack(int originalImageType,
                                             ij.ImageStack centroidValueStack)
Converts a stack into an RGB image or in a stack of gray of 8bit or 16bit or 32bit. It is used to compute back a layered image obtained from @link{SFCMManager} in order to visualize it

Parameters:
originalImageType - integer rapresenting the type of the original image
centroidValueStack - the stack of the clustered image
Returns:
the new Image econded in the stack.
